Key Match Events: The Reds plated nine runs in the fourth inning, turning the game into a blowout.
Simeon Woods Richardson gave up three runs off five hits while fanning three in three innings.
Louie Varland gave up a two-run, ground-rule double to Noelvi Marte, a two-run single to Jonathan India, a two-run double to Spencer Steer and a two-run homer to TJ Friedl.
Pre-Game Insights: The Twins had Carlos Correa, Byron Buxton and Royce Lewis all in the same lineup for the first time since July 2.
The Twins manager Rocco Baldelli emphasized the importance of getting through the game in the easiest way possible after the halfway point.
Post-Match Reflections: Twins manager Rocco Baldelli said the game was tough to watch, play in, manage, coach, the whole thing, and they had to find a way to get through the game in the easiest way possible.
Baldelli also expressed confidence in Louie Varland's ability to perform in important spots despite the rough outing.
Miscellaneous Highlights: The Detroit Tigers also lost to the Baltimore Orioles, so the Twins remain 2.5 games ahead of the Tigers for the final American League wild-card spot.
Simeon Woods Richardson reached 128 innings, the most he's ever pitched, and his stuff has been dropping as the rookie has reached this milestone.
Others: Jake Fraley hit a 380-foot solo homer off Scott Blewett in the fifth inning to make it 10-1, and Will Benson hit an RBI single off Caleb Thielbar in the eighth inning to add another to the beatdown.
Kyle Farmer pitched a 1-2-3 ninth inning, and he was the only Twins pitcher to not allow a run Saturday.
